#Lake Data

#Questions for Jay:
#-Why only 127 listings? Removing outliers? Does that change for RT and TO?
#-Is all this data from Wikipedia?
```{r}
lakes <-read.csv(here("Lake_Turnover_20130515.csv"),header=TRUE,sep=",")
head(lakes)
str(lakes)

lakes$logTurnover<-log10(lakes$Turnover)
lakes$logResidence<-log10(lakes$Residence)

Lake_TO <- ggplot(data = lakes[66:193,], mapping = aes (x = Turnover))+
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.5, boundary = 0, fill = "white", color = "black")+
  ylab("Frequency")+
  xlab("Turnover (1/yrs)")
Lake_TO

Lake_RT <- ggplot(data = lakes[1:127,], mapping = aes (x = Residence))+
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.5, boundary = 0, fill = "white", color = "black")+
  ylab("Frequency")+
  xlab("Residence Time (yrs)")
Lake_RT

Lake_TO <- ggplot(data = lakes[66:193,], mapping = aes (x = logTurnover))+
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.5, boundary = 0, fill = "white", color = "black")+
  ylab("Frequency")+
  xlab("Turnover (1/yrs)")
Lake_TO

Lake_logRT <- ggplot(data = lakes[1:127,], mapping = aes (x = logResidence))+
  geom_histogram(xlim = c(-3.5, 1.5), binwidth = 0.5, boundary = 0, fill = "white", color = "black")+
  ylab("Frequency")+
  xlab("log(Residence Time (yrs))")
Lake_logRT

```
